article.description: Laurent Rivard scored 18 points to lead five players in double figures for Harvard en route to a 74-69 victory over Monmouth (N.J.) on Wednesday night.
article.headline: Laurent Rivard, hot offense lead Harvard by Monmouth
article.linkText: Rivard, hot offense lead Harvard by Monmouth
article.story: CAMBRIDGE, Mass. -- Laurent Rivard scored 18 points to lead five players in double figures for Harvard en route to a 74-69 victory over Monmouth (N.J.) on Wednesday night. The Crimson (8-3) were 19 of 40 from the field (47.5 percent), including 8 for 17 from 3-point range (47.1 percent). But it was their work at the free-throw line that earned them the victory. Harvard made 28 of 35 free-throw attempts (80 percent) as the Hawks, who have lost four straight, committed 26 fouls. Oliver McNally scored 14, Brandyn Curry added 12 and Christian Webster and Kyle Casey 11 apiece for Harvard. Monmouth (4-9) outshot the Crimson from the field, going 23 for 47 overall (48.9 percent) and 12 of 21 from 3-point range (57.1 percent). Will Campbell scored 17 points and Gary Cox added 16 for the Hawks. The teams traded leads 22 times and the score was tied on 11 occasions.

statistics.name: points
statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.description: Field Goal makes and attempts.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.

statistics.name: minutes
statistics.description: The total number of minutes played.

statistics.name: assistTurnoverRatio
statistics.description: The average number of assists a player or team records per turnover

statistics.description: The total number of rebounds (offensive and defensive).

statistics.description: The number of times when the defense obtains the possession of the ball after a missed shot by the offense.
